intro: Gilia millefoliata, commonly known as the fringed gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Gilia millefoliata produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
